history.content:
I want to take Data 100 and Psych 117 at the same time but there's a 30 min time conflict. I know that Data 100 is webcasted and I think it allows time conflicts, but Psych 117 does not allow conflicts, even though I won't skip it and I plan to just watch Data 100 online. Is there a way around this? I couldn't enroll in both because Psych 117 does not allow it...

--- (merged since similar)

I would also appreciate clarification on how the system works when it comes to time conflicts.

1) I would like to enroll in CS 61B (conflicts not allowed) and EECS 127 (my discussion is at same time as 61b lecture; conflicts are allowed for 127). 

2) In the above situation, Data 100 does allow time conflicts, see the course listing.

According to https://sis.berkeley.edu/help/enrollment-faq/time-conflict, if one class does allow time conflict, the system should allow registration after providing an initial warning message.

However, based on this:

1) When I initially tried to enroll in 61B after 127, the system produced an error message without a "Yes" button as state on above site. Now, I am on the waitlist, but as the site also specifies, this error will not come up on joining the waitlist and instead later when reaching the top of waitlist. Seeing the followup on @11130, I now suspect this may happen to me once I reach the top of the waitlist despite the site stating that I should be allowed to enroll in both.

2) The above student should be allowed to enroll in both 100 and 117, since one of them allows conflicts.

How should both of us go about ensuring that we can each enroll in both our classes?
history.subject: Time conflicts....
